wikipedia_page.main: William Hutchins Callcott (1807 – 5 August 1882) was an English organist, composer and arranger of music.

response: Callcott's daughter Elizabeth married William Horsley who, in 1824, published A collection of Glees Canons and Catches, an edition of his father-in-law's works together with a Memoir of Dr Callcott. His son William Hutchins Callcott became a composer and arranger.
*  William Hutchins Callcott (1807–1882), British composer, son of John Wall Callcott
